main event: On October 29, 1952, a circular yellow light with a reddish glow around the outside was sighted traveling at 300-400 knots towards Hawaii by the C-50 crew over the Pacific Ocean.
interesting points: The report considered possibilities such as it being a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object due to insufficient data for evaluation.
The object emitted a pulsating pinkish light and moved at high speeds before moving off towards the west.
The crew observed the object for approximately 2-3 minutes before it moved away from the aircraft.
There were no photographs of the sighting included in the report.
sighted object: circular yellow light with a reddish glow
